titlestmt.titleproper: NCFA records relating to Synchroma machine

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:18:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: NCFA records relating to Synchroma machine

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records relating to a possible demonstration and exhibition of a Synchroma machine at the National Collection of Fine Arts. Correspondence is between Adelyn Breeskin and Jan Mulhert of the museum's 20th century department and inventors Stanley Elliott and Honore Guilbeau. Photographs, descriptive statements, and clippings are also included.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3161 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The National Collection of Fine Arts, a branch of the Smithsonian Institution, changed its name through an act of Congress to the National Museum of American Art in 1980. The Syncroma machine creates constantly changing visual images using sonic inputs supplied by the artist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Adelyn Breeskin represented NCFA in this gift to the Archives.

controlaccess.subject: Synchroma
